de.weltraumschaf.freemarkerdown

Interface PreProcessor


  • @NotThreadSafe
public interface PreProcessor
    A pre processor is invoked for each instruction it is registered for.

    Example: A preprocessor which has the target "foo" will be invoked for all instructions introduced by <?foo ... ?>. So if a template with this content is rendered: 

     Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
 <?foo some instructions ?>
 consetetur sadipscing elitr
 <?foo something else ?>
 sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor

    The preprocessor will receive two strings:

    1. " some instructions "
    2. " something else "

    The whole processing instruction will be replaced by the return value of the processor. So if the pre processor here in the example will return always the string "FOO" the result will be: 

     Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
 FOO
 consetetur sadipscing elitr
 FOO
 sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor

    See this Wikipedia article for more informations about processing instructions.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Sven Strittmatter

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getTarget()
      Get the target name of the processor.
      String process(String input)
      Processes the given input string.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        String process(String input)
        Processes the given input string.
        Parameters:
        input - must not be null
        Returns:
        never null

      • getTarget

        String getTarget()
        Get the target name of the processor.

        If you want to process instructions introduced with <?foo then you must return foo in your implementation of this method.

        Returns:
        never null, never empty
